Description: Shoulder sherd of Attic black-figured pottery closed vessel, oinochoe, amphora, or hydria; exterior: band of alternating added red and black tongues with brown dividing lines at top of shoulder; below, black-figure chariot scene (top of necks and heads of two horses, red on mane of near horse, bending to right; upper part of youth with red on garment, to left).
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For a parallel, see British Museum amphora 1920,0315.2.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 463, no. B787)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0324) (Phase 1)
CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (p. 96, pl. III, no. 5)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
